div.p: This is an optional attribute found in WRITING RECEPTION RRESPONSES . which allows you to indicate whether a response to a work was formal or informal. Formal means that the response was printed or otherwise made public; informal refers to private opinion expressed in a letter or in conversation, or in those incidents more difficult to define: a hearty slap on the back, rude looks from strangers on buses, a snubbing by her social set. It has two associated VALUEs: formal and informal. It has sibling attributes of GENDEREDRESPONSE and RESPONSETYPE.

div.codeblock: <RRESPONSES FORMALITY="formal" RESPONSETYPE="re-evaluation">An attack on Joanna Baillie's work written by Francis Jeffrey signalled the decline of her reputation.</RRESPONSES>
<RRESPONSES FORMALITY="formal" REPONSETYPE="initial">While praising Hannah More's style and her skill at manipulating readers, Smith damned the novel as overly moralized.</RRESPONSES>

div.p: The informal value is less frequently used because it is harder to identify.
